intro: Meriania juan-canoi, commonly known as Juan-Cano's meriania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, often violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are glossy in appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
